refnamediv.refpurpose: portably storing integers in pointer variables.

refsynopsisdiv.title: Synopsis

refsect1.title: Description

warning.para: YOU MAY NOT STORE POINTERS IN INTEGERS. THIS IS NOT PORTABLE IN ANY WAY SHAPE OR FORM. These macros ONLY allow storing integers in pointers, and only preserve 32 bits of the integer; values outside the range of a 32-bit integer will be mangled.

refsect2.title: GINT_TO_POINTER()
refsect2.para: Stuffs an integer into a pointer type.

Remember, YOU MAY NOT STORE POINTERS IN INTEGERS. THIS IS NOT PORTABLE IN ANY WAY SHAPE OR FORM. These macros ONLY allow storing integers in pointers, and only preserve 32 bits of the integer; values outside the range of a 32-bit integer will be mangled.

listitem.simpara: integer to stuff into a pointer.

refsect2.title: GPOINTER_TO_INT()
refsect2.para: Extracts an integer from a pointer. The integer must have been stored in the pointer with GINT_TO_POINTER().

Remember, YOU MAY NOT STORE POINTERS IN INTEGERS. THIS IS NOT PORTABLE IN ANY WAY SHAPE OR FORM. These macros ONLY allow storing integers in pointers, and only preserve 32 bits of the integer; values outside the range of a 32-bit integer will be mangled.

refsect2.title: GUINT_TO_POINTER()
refsect2.para: Stuffs an unsigned integer into a pointer type.

listitem.simpara: unsigned integer to stuff into the pointer.

refsect2.title: GPOINTER_TO_UINT()
refsect2.para: Extracts an unsigned integer from a pointer. The integer must have been stored in the pointer with GUINT_TO_POINTER().

listitem.simpara: pointer to extract an unsigned integer from.

refsect2.title: GSIZE_TO_POINTER()
refsect2.para: Stuffs a gsize into a pointer type.

listitem.simpara: gsize to stuff into the pointer.

refsect2.title: GPOINTER_TO_SIZE()
refsect2.para: Extracts a gsize from a pointer. The gsize must have been stored in the pointer with GSIZE_TO_POINTER().

listitem.simpara: pointer to extract a gsize from.
